p.seg: Referring to an application from the Head Master of Ormond College for a set of the Educational Collection of Plants prepared by you for the use of Public Institutions in Victoria,

p.style: font-family: Geneva; margin-left: 0.3335in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: -0.3335in; font-size: 9pt;

note.p: On 15 May 1885, J. H. Macfarland, Master of Ormond College at the University of Melbourne, had written to the Chief Secretary, G. Berry: 'At the suggestion of Baron Von Mueller I write to ask for one of the sets of the "Educational Collection of Plants" which have been prepared for public institutions in Victoria. The authorities of this College are anxious to promote in every way the study of Natural Science and you are no doubt aware that the College is open to members of all religious […] […] who have matriculated at the University while our lectures are open to all whether members of the University or not.' (C85/5048, unit 258, VPRS 3992/P, Public Record Office, Victoria). This request was forwarded to M on 18 May.

p.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 9pt; margin-left: 0.3335in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0.1598in;

note.p: MS annotation dated 20 May: 'Of these Industrial Collections of plants there are [now] (see enclosed file) about [11] complete sets in the office vaults, where they are doing no good whatever. The Govt. Botanist desires to have them sent to him. Would it not be well to comply with his request, so that they may be turned to some useful purpose? In that case the Government Botanist might be instructed to send one set, which he would see is properly completed, to the Ormond College, where probably good use would be made of it. At all events [...] [...] be in the right place.' check original for gaps.

p.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 9pt; margin-left: 0.4929in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;

note.p: See also M to T. Wilson, 20 September 1884, M to T. Wilson, 9 June 1885 (in this edition as 85-09-06).

p.seg: I have now the honour to transmit to you one set with the request that you will be so good as to see that it is complete, and then return it for transmission to Mr Macfarland.
There still remain in this Office 10 other similar sets, and the Chief Secretary will be glad if you will suggest the best way in which they can be utilized.

p.style: font-family: Geneva; margin-left: 0.3335in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: -0.3335in; font-size: 9pt;

note.p: MS annotation dated 31 May: 'Forward one set to the Ormond College The Govt Botanist can nominate other public bodies for a similar purpose'.

p.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;

div.p: I have the honour to be,
